params.taskDescription:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msub>
      <mi>c</mi>
      <mn>1</mn>
    </msub>
  </mrow>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>11</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{c_1} = 11</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>r</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>4</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">r = 4</annotation></semantics></math>, find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msub>
      <mi>c</mi>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <mn>12</mn>
      </mrow>
    </msub>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{c_{12}}</annotation></semantics></math>.

</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{t_1} = 100</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>

  </mfrac>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">r = \frac{1}{5}</annotation></semantics></math>, find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>

  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{t_{10}}</annotation></semantics></math>.

questionSetStimulus: For the following exercises, the first term and the common ratio of a geometric sequence is given. Using that information, determine the indicated term of the sequence.
